Commentary: ['   Hello, and welcome to live coverage of this fixture in the Premier League, as Wolverhampton Wanderers take on Arsenal at Molineux.   ', '   In the final round of Premier League fixtures before the World Cup takes place, rock-bottom Wolves have the toughest task of all, facing Arsenal, who sit atop the pile in first place. The hosts have lost their of their last four, and newly-appointed head coach Julen Lopetegui doesn’t start in his role until November 14th.   ', '   Arsenal, meanwhile, are flying, having won their last two games without conceding a goal while scoring six at the other end. With nearest rivals Manchester City having lost their most recent fixture to Brentford, Mikel Arteta’s Gunners have the chance to move five points clear of the chasing pack with a win in the West Midlands.   ', '   WOLVES (5-3-2): Jose Sa; Nelson Semedo, Maximilian Kilman, Nathan Collins, Tote Gomes, Hugo Bueno; Boubacar Traore, Ruben Neves, Joao Moutinho; Adama Traore, Goncalo Guedes.   ', '   WOLVES SUBS: Matija Sarkic, Rayan Ait-Nouri, Daniel Podence, Yerson Mosquera, Connor Ronan, Matheus Nunes, Joseph Hodge, Chem Campbell, Dexter Lembikisa.   ', '   ARSENAL (4-3-3): Aaron Ramsdale; Ben White, William Saliba, Gabriel Magalhaes, Oleksandr Zinchenko; Martin Odegaard, Thomas Partey, Granit Xhaka; Bukayo Saka, Gabriel Jesus, Gabriel Martinelli.   ', '   ARSENAL SUBS: Matt Turner, Kieran Tierney, Eddie Nketiah, Rob Holding, Cedric Soares, Fabio Vieira, Reiss Nelson, Mohamed Elneny, Marquinhos.   ', '   Wolves make two changes from their League Cup victory over Leeds in midweek, with Adama Traore back in the side, playing on the right of a front two. It’s five at the back too for the hosts, with Tote Gomes slotting in at the back.   ', '   Arsenal are unchanged from their last league outing, a 1-0 win over Chelsea, with Arteta not tempted to tinker with the XI that many see as his strongest. Gabriel Magalhaes got the winner at Stamford Bridge, and is part of a back four that have conceded just 11 goals so far this season, the joint-lowest in the league.   ', "   The teams head out onto the Molineux pitch, and we're nearly ready for kick-off here!   ", "  1'  Jesus kicks off for Arsenal, and we are off and running in the West Midlands!   ", "  3'  Play halts early on, and Arsenal put the ball out. It's Xhaka who is down, and doesn't look injured, so the midfielder could indeed be feeling unwell at the start of this game.   ", "  4'  Xhaka is cleared to continue playing and returns to the pitch, meaning the game can get underway again!   ", "  5'  Arsenal have won six of their eight Premier League away games against Wolves, and have scored at least once in all 16 of their meetings with them in the competition.   ", "  6'  BALL IN THE NET!!! Martinelli cuts inside and crosses beyond Tote. Jesus is onto it, and smashes a half-volley into the bottom corner, but the flag is up to deny the Brazilian his sixth goal of the season!   ", "  7'  CHANCE!!! Wolves play through Arsenal's high line and Boubacar Traore has it on the right. He passes centrally to Guedes, but Ramsdale's out to deny him, and Adama Traore's rebound is blocked by Saliba!   ", "  9'  Wolves lost home and away against Arsenal in the league last season, having lost just two of their previous eight against them.   ", "  11'  A ball over the top bounces Jesus' way, and he turns Kilman looking to shoot, but a good defensive header from Tote gets the ball back to Sa in the Wolves goal.   ", "  13'  Semedo wins Wolves' first corner of the game, and after playing a one-two with Moutinho, Guedes crosses, but it takes a deflection off White and goes out for another corner.   ", "  14'  Saka has it on the byline and whips an early cross towards the front post. It takes a nick off Tote on its way through, leaving Sa scrambling as he tips it behind for a corner!   ", "  15'  Saka's corner is flicked on by Gabriel in the centre of the box, but his glancing header isn't powerful enough and skews well wide!   ", "        Fábio Vieira   G. Xhaka               16'  Xhaka does eventually come off having pulled up with illness earlier in the game, and Fabio Vieira is called from the bench to replace him.   ", "  18'  Arsenal are the only side to have scored in every Premier League game this season, while they've also got the joint-fewest goals conceded and joint-most clean sheets so far, with 11 and six respectively. The Gunners are looking to win three consecutive league games without conceding for the first time since July 2020.   ", "  19'  Semedo looks to find Adama Traore with a long ball behind the defence, but the Wolves forward doesn't time his run and would've been offside if he'd collected it.   ", "  20'  OVER!!! After Martinelli slips over, Wolves race down the right on the counter and it's played forward to Guedes. He surges towards the box before pulling the trigger, and sends a decent effort inches over the bar!   ", "  22'  As well as having the fewest goals (eight) and lowest shot conversion rate (4.8 per cent) in the league this season, Wolves have had fewer different goalscorers than any other side, with just four. Neves has netted half of their eight goals so far this term.   ", "  23'  WIDE!! White's cross from the right is aimed towards Martinelli, but a good Semedo header takes the ball away from him. Zinchenko crosses the ball back into the box, where Jesus' glancing header flashes just wide!   ", "  25'  Arsenal have scored in each of their last 29 meetings with Wolves in all competitions since a 1-0 loss back in February 1979. Only against West Bromwich Albion (32) are the Gunners currently on a longer scoring streak in all competitions.   ", "  27'  Bueno does well to dispossess Odegaard as the Arsenal captain tries to create crossing space, and the young Wolves wing-back also frustrates White after the England defender fails to win a corner.   ", "  29'  Moutinho looks to move forward on the counter for Wolves, but he's dragged back by Odegaard. The Arsenal midfielder is penalised, but not booked, in a decision which the home fans aren't exactly happy with.   ", "  31'  Arsenal have had three players sent off in their last two league away games in Wolverhampton, with Martinelli seeing red last season, and both David Luiz and Bernd Leno doing so in the same game February 2021.   ", "  33'  A long throw-in from Partey is launched into the Wolves box, and Neves has to head it beyond for a corner to prevent the chance progressing any further!   ", "  35'  Boubacar Traore's superb run sparks a Wolves counter-attack, but the final ball from Moutinho to Guedes is cut out! He would've been through on goal there!   ", "  36'  OFF THE BAR!!! Arsenal take advantage of Wolves committing men forward and Saka puts Jesus in behind. He narrows the angle before shooting with his right, and smashes the ball beyond Sa, but off the bar and over!   ", "        Toti   Yellow Card               37'  Neves loses the ball on the edge of Arsenal's box and Jesus bursts forward with it, but he's tripped on halfway by Tote, who is booked by the referee.   ", "  39'  Wolves have won just one of their last eight Premier League games, drawing one and losing six. They've conceded at least three goals in four of these eight games, as many times as they had in their previous 49 matches in the competition.   ", "  40'  WIDE!!! White floats a cross to the back post with red and white shirts queuing up, but Jesus mistimes his finish and side-foots a volley wide of the target!   ", "  41'  Guedes looks to turn Gabriel but goes down on the edge of the box. He's fuming to have not been given one, as Adama Traore collects the ball and blasts well over from the edge of the box!   ", "  43'  Forward come Arsenal again as White's throw-in is only half-cleared. It's squared to Vieira on the edge of the box, but Wolves have plenty at the back and Collins blocks the effort!   ", "  44'  BLOCKED!!! Saliba passes back to no-one, and Guedes races onto it, shooting for the far corner from just inside the box, and his effort needs a good block from Gabriel to put it behind for a corner!   ", "  45'  We'll play two minutes of added time to close out the first half.   ", "        B. Traoré   Yellow Card               45' + 1'  Jesus advances down the left for Arsenal and cuts inside towards the box, but he's stopped before he can get there as Boubacar Traore drags him down, and the Wolves midfielder is booked.   ", "  45' + 2'  HALF-TIME: WOLVES 0-0 ARSENAL.   ", "   A goalless first half comes to an end, and it's not exactly been a match for the ages. The two sides have both played quite reserved football, and the defences are definitely on top at the moment. Arsenal have had the ball in the net, but only from Jesus in an offside position. With that goal not given, chances were few and far between, with neither Sa nor Ramsdale forced into a serious save. The second half should see the game open up a bit more, with the cagey start to the match hopefully giving way to some goals!   ", "   Jesus' goalscoring drought hasn't been broken in that first half, but the Brazil forward has shown why he's so important all across the pitch for Arsenal. He's held the ball up superbly well for the Gunners, winning six of his nine duels, with half of these coming in the air. He's completed every pass he's made in the final third, and has also won possession back three times, via a tackle, clearance and interception apiece. Active.   ", "   The teams return for the second half, and here's hoping we see some goals in the next 45 minutes!   ", "  46'  Neves resumes proceedings for Wolves, and we're back underway at Molineux!   ", "  47'  Arsenal have won all three of their Premier League games so far this season when going into half time level - they last had a longer such run between August and October 2018, a run of seven.   ", "  48'  CHANCE!!! Collins heads Odegaard's cross clear and Wolves burst forward on the break. Adama Traore passes wide to Guedes, who is in open space. He crosses to the back post, where Adama Traore has run for the return ball, but Ramsdale gets down to smother the ball before it reaches him!   ", "  50'  Semedo is clipped late by Partey, but the referee plays advantage with Adama Traore on the ball. He floats one towards Guedes in the box, but Gabriel intercepts for the Gunners!   ", "  51'  Arsenal have stopped the opposition from scoring a first-half goal in 11 of their 14 games so far this season, with only Newcastle doing so more often (13 times) in the Premier League.   ", "        T. Partey   Yellow Card               52'  Following that foul on Semedo, the referee comes back to book Partey for his off-the-ball challenge on the Wolves right-back.   ", "  54'  Wolves failed to score a first-half goal for the 10th time this season. In the 15 games so far, only West Ham and Everton (both 11) have failed to score more often league.   ", "        Fábio Vieira   Assist               54'  The ball from Jesus was exquisite, and Vieira's timing of run and awareness to find his teammates was just as good!   ", "        M. Ødegaard   Goal               54'  GOOOAAALLL!!! Arsenal take the lead!! Jesus cut inside from the left before threading a delightful ball through for Vieira, and he squares it across the face of goal where Odegaard and Saka are waiting to tap it home! Odegaard gets the crucial touch, and that well-worked finish puts Arsenal 1-0 up with 10 gone in the second half!   ", "  57'  Arsenal have now scored nine goals in the first 15 minutes of the second half, more than any other team in the Premier League this season.   ", "  59'  Semedo blasts a ball into the box, but the midriff of Martinelli gets in the way, deflecting the ball out over the sideline as the Brazilian wreathes in pain on the floor!   ", "        Gabriel Magalhães   Yellow Card               60'  Adama Traore gets beyond Saliba and sprints down the left towards the box. Gabriel slides in recklessly, catching the forward right on the edge of the area, and he's booked for the foul that could well have ended up being a penalty rather than free-kick!   ", "  61'  SAVED!!! From the free-kick, Guedes blasts a low shot to the near post, but Ramsdale sees it all the way and does well to hold the shot!   ", "  62'  CHANCE!!! Vieira flicks White's cross on to Martinelli, whose ball back across the face is parried away by Sa. Odegaard volleys the rebound goalwards, but Tote gets in the way and Wolves scramble it clear!   ", "  64'  Victory for Arsenal will mean they are top of the Premier League table at Christmas for the first time since 2007-08. However, the Gunners haven't gone on to win the title in any of the last five times they've topped the table at Christmas (1951-52, 1986-87, 1989-90, 2002-03 and 2007-08), last doing so in 1947-48.   ", "  65'  CHANCE!!! Jesus is found in space and takes on Collins. He resists shooting though, instead squaring for Odegaard, and Kilman puts it behind for a corner!   ", "  67'  Collins gets forward to win a header and he links up with Adama Traore. He bursts past two before crossing from the byline, but Ramsdale is out to pluck the teasing ball out of the air.   ", "        Daniel Podence   João Moutinho               68'  Moutinho comes off in Wolves' first change, and he's replaced by Daniel Podence, making his first appearance for the side since picking up an injury in August.   ", "        D. Lembikisa   Nélson Semedo               68'  Semedo also comes off having picked up a knock, and Dexter Lembikisa, making his Premier League debut, replaces him.   ", "  69'  Podence chips over the top for Adama Traore, but Gabriel's cushioned header sends the ball back to Ramsdale. The Wolves forward can't stop in time though, and collides with the Arsenal goalkeeper in the box!   ", "  70'  Ramsdale is given treatment following that knock from Adama Traore, and he's eventually passed fit and play continues.   ", "  72'  Arsenal are now the only side in the Premier League this season to have scored in each of their league games, doing so now in all 14.   ", "  73'  Guedes cuts in-field but is crowded out by Arsenal defenders. However, play is brought back for a free-kick in Guedes' favour, due to a shirt pull on his from White.   ", "        M. Ødegaard   Goal               75'  GOOOOAAAALLL!!! The Gunners make it two!!! Martinelli beats Lembikisa before finding Zinchenko, whose near-post cross is half-cleared. Martinelli stabs it goalwards, but this too is denied, until the ball drops to Odegaard who lashes it into the bottom corner!! 2-0 to Arsenal, and their captain has really made the difference in this second half!   ", "  77'  Podence's throughball finds Guedes with space in the box, but the Portuguese winger chooses to shoot from a tight angle, and sprays his shot well wide of goal!   ", "  78'  Guedes does brilliantly to flick the ball over Saliba's head before racing to the edge of the box. He looks to shoot, but takes too long, allowing Gabriel to step in with a vital intervention and win the ball!   ", "  79'  Martinelli's far-post cross is headed away by Tote, but White follows in from the edge of the box, dragging his volley wide of the far post!   ", "        Matheus Nunes   Toti               80'  Wolves look to their attacking options late on, as centre-back Tote is withdrawn for creative midfielder Matheus Nunes.   ", "  82'  Adama Traore takes on Partey in the box before laying it back to his namesake Boubacar, who hits a first-time shot towards goal and curls it wide of Ramsdale's right-hand post!   ", "  84'  CHANCE!!! Zinchenko's slip allows Adama Traore space to burst into the box, but the cut-back for his teammates is woeful and finds only open space!   ", "  85'  Arsenal counter as Jesus holds up the ball before freeing up Saka. He races down the right and finds Jesus with a return ball, but it's put behind for a corner by Collins!   ", "  86'  WIDE!!! From Arsenal's corner, Wolves launch a counter-attack of their own as Adama Traore surges into open pasture. He hangs a cross from the byline towards Podence, who brings the ball down, flicks it up again, and fires an acrobatic bicycle kick towards goal and wide!   ", "  87'  Matheus glides through midfield before spotting the diagonal run of Podence into the box, but his throughball is dived upon by Ramsdale for Arsenal!   ", "  89'  SAVED!!! Adama Traore runs into the area before finding Podence to his right, and his first-time shot is too hot for Ramsdale to handle as he tips it behind for a corner!   ", "  90'  Adama Traore's cross from a short corner is headed clear, but Neves attempts an audacious shot back in on the volley, which clears the crossbar by some distance!   ", "  90' + 1'  We're into four minutes of added time as Arsenal look to close out yet another victory in this game.   ", "        R. Nelson   B. Saka               90' + 1'  Mikel Arteta makes a triple sub in the last few moments, with Saka coming off for Reiss Nelson on the right flank.   ", "        Mohamed Elneny   Fábio Vieira               90' + 1'  Fabio Vieira, who came on right at the start for the ill Xhaka, is substituted again, and Mohamed Elneny replaces him.   ", "        Cédric Soares   O. Zinchenko               90' + 1'  Zinchenko also comes off at left-back, and Cedric Soares comes on for the rest of the game.   ", "        Hugo Bueno   Yellow Card               90' + 2'  Bueno knocks Nelson to the ground as the two contest a bouncing ball from Cedric's clearance, and the Wolves wing-back is booked late on.   ", "  90' + 4'  FULL-TIME: WOLVES 0-2 ARSENAL.   ", "   Two second-half goals from captain Martin Odegaard seal the win for Arsenal, which sends them five points clear of Manchester City at the top of the Premier League table! Odegaard's opening strike, a tap in from inches out, didn't exactly open the floodgates, but Wolves did have chances of their own through Guedes and Podence. Odegaard smashed in a second late in the game though, consigning the hosts to being bottom of the table at Christmas; a table that his Gunners will be sitting on top of over the World Cup break.   ", "   Odegaard managed three shots on target, scoring Arsenal's match-winning goals with two of them. The Norwegian was busy in the middle of the park, winning possession seven times, one of which came in Wolves' own defensive third. He made a sole tackle, but also conceded two free-kicks, giving a reflection on how scrappy and competitive the midfield battle was at Molineux.   ", "   A seventh defeat in nine games leaves Wolves in last place going into the World Cup, and new boss Julen Lopetegui has plenty of work to do over the break in order for the side to recover. They're four points clear of safety after 15 games, which despite being bleak, is far from an insurmountable task. Arsenal, meanwhile, are five clear at the summit, and head into the remainder of the season as the team to beat. Could the Gunners' first title win since 2004 really be on the cards?   ", "   That's all from us, we hope you enjoyed the game. Until next time, goodbye!   "]

Commentary: ['   Hello and welcome to live coverage of the Premier League meeting between Brentford and Manchester United at the Brentford Community Stadium!   ', "   Erik ten Hag's first match in charge of Manchester United ended in defeat last weekend, with Brighton and Hove Albion earning their first ever win at Old Trafford with a 2-1 victory, and he'll be looking to get things on track here today. Like United, Brentford found themselves 2-0 down last weekend but came from behind to draw 2-2 with Leicester City in their opening match of the season.   ", '   BRENTFORD STARTING XI (4-3-3): David Raya; Aaron Hickey, Pontus Jansson, Ben Mee, Rico Henry; Mads Roerslev Rasmussen, Christian Norgaard, Mathias Jensen; Bryan Mbuemo, Ivan Toney, Josh Dasilva.   ', '   BRENTFORD SUBS: Yoane Wissa, Vitaly Janelt, Thomas Strakosha, Keane Lewis-Potter, Mikkel Damsgaard, Saman Ghoddos, Shandon Baptiste, Mads Bech Sorensen, Frank Ogochukwu Onyeka.   ', '   MANCHESTER UNITED STARTING XI (4-3-3): David de Gea; Diogo Dalot, Harry Maguire, Lisandro Martinez, Luke Shaw; Christian Eriksen, Fred, Bruno Fernandes; Jadon Sancho, Cristiano Ronaldo, Marcus Rashford.   ', '   MANCHESTER UNITED SUBS: Tom Heaton, James Garner, Anthony Elanga, Alejandro Garnacho, Raphael Varane, Donny van de Beek, Scott McTominay, Aaron Wan-Bissaka, Tyrell Malacia.   ', '   Thomas Frank makes two changes to the side that drew with Leicester last weekend, as Roerslev and Dasilva, who came off the bench to score the equaliser in that game, come into the team. Janelt and Wissa drop to the bench, where new signing Damsgaard is also named.   ', '   Just the one change by Ten Hag to his team after their loss to Brighton last time out. Ronaldo is brought in to lead the line, which sees Eriksen drop into a deeper role as he faces his old club. McTominay starts on the bench.   ', '   Brentford are winless in six top-flight meetings with United (D1 L5), since beating them twice in the 1936-37 season.   ', '   The teams are out on the pitch now, with kick-off just moments away!   ', "  1'  Fernandes gets the game underway for United!   ", "  2'  Martinez hooks a clearance upfield and Rashford spins away from Roerslev with a good bit of control. He slides it through to Ronaldo, who goes down under pressure from Mee, but there was nothing in it.   ", "  4'  United have made a bright start to this game and they're moving it upfield quickly. Ronaldo flicks it to Fernandes, who lays it straight back to the forward. He takes on the shot from range, but it's straight at Raya.   ", "  6'  Jensen's long throw-in causes United a few problems and it pinballs through the box. Mee manages to touch it towards Toney in the middle, but Eriksen forces him wide before giving away the corner.   ", "  8'  Shaw goes for the big switch out to Sancho on the right and he brings it down while holding off Henry. He squares it to Fernandes, who tries to help it out to Shaw, but his touch gets away from him.   ", "        J. Dasilva   Goal               10'  DASILVA SCORES! And it's a moment to forget for De Gea! It comes from United's throw-in and Ronaldo loses out to Jensen. He squares it to Dasilva, and the United players are slow to close him down so he has a go from range. It's low to De Gea's near post and it flies straight through his hands and into the bottom corner. 1-0 Brentford!   ", "        M. Jensen   Assist               10'  Jensen didn't win the original header against Ronaldo, but he got a foot in with a good challenge to win it back.   ", "  12'  CHANCE! United work it upfield quickly as they try to get straight back into this game and Shaw fizzes it across the edge of the box. Sancho touches it into Fernandes, who hits the shot first time and fires it high into the stands.   ", "  14'  Ronaldo is urging his team-mates to calm down as they seem a bit shaky after conceding the opener. Brentford work it upfield well again and Mbuemo has a go from range, but it's well blocked by Maguire.   ", "        H. Maguire   Yellow Card               16'  Eriksen's first touch bounces straight off Jensen and Maguire slides in to stop Dasilva from running straight at goal. He's shown the first yellow card of the game.   ", "  17'  CLOSE! Jensen steps up to take the free-kick on the edge of the D and it's a good effort. Commentary: ["   Hello and welcome to live coverage of today's Premier League clash between Wolves and Fulham at Molineux!   ", "   Wolves will tackle their first home fixture of the new season, seeking to bounce back from defeat at Leeds United on the Premier League's opening day. Despite taking an early lead at Elland Road, Bruno Lage's side returned to the Midlands empty-handed following a 2-1 loss. During his first campaign at the club, Lage saw his team accrue three fewer points at Molineux than they managed away from home.   ", "   Seeking to build on a draw with last season's Premier League runners-up Liverpool last weekend, Fulham are on their first road trip since winning promotion in May. Top dogs in the Championship in the 2021-22 campaign, the Cottagers' return to the top flight ended in a 2-2 home draw. Marco Silva's men won 13 away games as they claimed first place in the second tier, but they must step up in class today.   ", '   WOLVES (4-2-3-1): Jose Sa; Jonny Castro Otto, Nathan Collins, Max Kilman, Rayan Ait-Nouri; Leander Dendoncker, Ruben Neves; Daniel Podence, Morgan Gibbs-White, Pedro Neto; Hwang Hee-Chan.   ', '   SUBS: Matija Sarkic, Willy Boly, Tote Gomes, Chem Campbell, Connor Ronan, Nelson Semedo, Luke Cundle, Goncalo Guedes, Adama Traore.   ', '   FULHAM (4-2-3-1): Marek Rodak; Kenny Tete, Tosin Adarabioyo, Tim Ream, Antonee Robinson; Harrison Reed, Joao Palhinha; Neeskens Kebano, Andreas Pereira, Bobby De Cordova-Reid; Aleksandar Mitrovic.   ', '   SUBS: Bernd Leno, Kevin Mbabu, Issa Diop, Shane Duffy, Rodrigo Muniz, Tom Cairney, Tyrese Francois, Jay Stansfield, Nathaniel Chalobah.   ', '   Following the exit of Conor Coady and arrival of Portuguese winger Guedes from Valencia this week, Wolves still select the same starting lineup that lost to Leeds United on the opening day. While Hwang continues to lead the line up front - supported by Podence and Neto - Guedes starts on the bench.   ', "   Fulham also keep faith in the XI who started last week, in the 2-2 draw with Liverpool. Last term's top scorer Mitrovic leads the attack once more, while Diop - signed from West Ham this week - is among the visitors' substitutes. In midfield, recent arrival Palhinha comes up against several of his countrymen from Portugal.   ", '   The players are out on the pitch at a sunny Molineux, with kick-off now just moments away!   ', "  1'  Fulham kick off, and we are under way in Wolverhampton!   ", "  3'  SAVE! The first chance falls to Neto, who slips through the Fulham defence on the left side of the area before firing a near-post shot at Rodak. The ball then rebounds threateningly across the goal-line, but the flag is then raised for offside.   ", "  5'  GOOD STOP! Rodak is called upon once again, as Hwang makes the same sprint through the Fulham back four as Neto - shooting towards the near post from 10 yards out. The goalkeeper makes a routine stop, but was well positioned to do so. Wolves are looking dangerous!   ", "  7'  Before today's game, Wolves had won nine of their last 12 league games against Fulham - edging the last three in a row by the same 1-0 scoreline.   ", "  9'  Gibbs-White, who has been serenaded by the crowd throughout the game so far, is brought down by Palhinha's trip in midfield, but Wolves fail to make anything of the subsequent free-kick.   ", "  11'  After Neto fires a low cross along the six-yard box from the left, the ball bounces out to Hwang 20 yards out, but the Wolves striker snatches at his shot, which sails high and wide of the target.   ", "  13'  Wolves are certainly on top in the opening stages of their first home match, and they will want to capitalise soon, given Fulham's ability to strike on the break.   ", "  15'  With an opportunistic volley from just outside the box, Mitrovic sends the ball careering well over the crossbar and into the jeering fans behind the Wolves goal.   ", "        Daniel Podence   Yellow Card               17'  After taking a heavy touch and then hauling back Reed in an attempt to retrieve the ball, Podence is shown the game's first yellow card.   ", "  19'  Pereira picks up a good position on the left side of the area, but his attempted cutback to Mitrovic is heavily overhit and zips out of play on the far side of the pitch.   ", "  21'  OFF THE LINE! After Kilman is forced to head the ball behind inside his own area, Fulham's first corner - delivered by Pereira - picks out Decordova-Reid in the centre of the box. His goal-bound header is hacked away off the line by Neves, and the rebound is then scrambled clear.   ", "  23'  Having narrowly escaped at the other end, Wolves earn another corner, but Gibbs-White's cross is cleared away from danger by the Fulham defence at the second attempt.   ", "  24'  Due to the heat in England today, a cooling break is under way, with both coaches taking the opportunity to speak to their players while the teams take on water.   ", "  26'  The game resumes following the drinks break, and Fulham make a rare foray into the Wolves half, which the hosts then repel.   ", "  28'  The home side's dominance extends to having 61 per cent of the ball so far, but Wolves have only managed two shots at goal compared to Fulham's three.   ", "  31'  CLOSE! A terrible mix-up between Rodak and Tosin almost results in a Wolves goal, as they collide on the right side of the area; allowing Neto to steal the ball. His cross-shot falls to Podence, who fails to capitalise and drags his attempt wide.   ", "  33'  Never troubling Sa, a low strike from Robinson, who had drifted into a central spot - around 20 yards out - flies past the right-hand post.   ", "  35'  Wolves captain Neves makes a hash of striking a long-range free-kick at goal, and the ball sails well wide of the right-hand post.   ", "        Rúben Neves   Yellow Card               36'  For a crunching late tackle on his compatriot Palhinha, Neves is the second Wolves player booked today.   ", "  37'  Tempers seem to be fraying in the heat at Molineux, as Palhinha is pulled up for an aggressive aerial challenge on Gibbs-White. Of course, he doesn't agree, but Wolves will have a free-kick.   ", "  39'  Confined to a tight spot by the corner flag, Ait-Nouri does well to buy a goal-kick by playing the ball off a Fulham player. Such craft pleases the home fans too.   ", "  41'  Kebano complains after going down as Fulham attempt to counter, following a Wolves corner-kick. The referee is not interested, though, and the game goes on - we are ambling towards half-time here.   ", "  43'  Neto receives the ball from Podence's clipped crossfield pass, but the chance of bursting into the area from the left is ended when he is brought down by Palhinha.   ", "        João Palhinha   Yellow Card               44'  A foul on Neto deep inside his own half sees Palhinha pick up a yellow card - Fulham's first of the game.   ", "  45'  The ball falls into the path of Neves from a corner, but unable to get his body into the right shape to strike it cleanly, the Wolves skipper sends his shot well wide of the left-hand post.   ", "  45' + 2'  The officials have indicated there will be at least two minutes of stoppage time at the end of the first half.   ", "  45' + 3'  HALF-TIME: WOLVES 0-0 FULHAM   ", "   Having bossed the ball and carved out more openings than their visitors, Wolves will be disappointed that their lack of cutting edge has cost them a deserved lead at the break. Neto has persistently threatened to unpick Fulham when drifting in from the left, but the hosts are yet to find the finishing touch. Following last week's heroics, Silva's side have put in a low-key performance so far and must hope to improve after the interval.   ", '   Wolves are without a win from their last 11 Premier League games in August (since a home win against Fulham in 2011), while Fulham are winless in their last 10 top-flight visits to Molineux, since 1962. Surely something has to give in the second half?   ', "  46'  We are back under way in Wolverhampton!   ", "  47'  Neves escapes censure for a couple of crunching challenges in midfield, and the home crowd have responded warmly to their captain's endeavour. After receiving the ball in space on the left, Ait-Nouri surges down the flank and delivers a delicious low ball to the back post, which Gibbs-White can only turn over from close range, at full stretch. ", "  64'  Fulham are sustaining some light pressure on the Wolves rearguard for the first time, but Kilman clears the danger first of all, then Ait-Nouri unintentionally turns the ball back into his goalkeeper's gloves following a dangerous cross.   ", "  66'  A corner from Gibbs-White is played short to Neto, but the move quickly breaks down. Wolves manage to retrieve the ball, though, and start to build again.   ", "  68'  Twice, Robinson excels himself in keeping Wolves at bay, as he blocks a pair of attempts to load the ball into Fulham's six-yard box.   ", "  69'  SAVE! Evading a tired-looking Jonny, Kebano drops his shoulder on the left flank and thumps a near-post shot at Sa from the edge of the area. The Fulham winger is getting plenty of joy in that position, but can't quite find the final product.   ", "  71'  The second-half drinks break takes place, and it looks like Fulham will be making a change once play resumes in the searing heat.   ", "  73'  We are back under way, after both teams take on energy drinks and tactical instruction in the shade of the stands.   ", "  75'  Guedes brings down Ream, as the hosts grow ever more desperate to get forward and find a spark in the final third. Nothing is happening up front, so Wolves are set to make some changes.   ", "  77'  Neto delays several times before releasing the ball to Ait-Nouri on the left side of the area, and the full-back's looping cross ultimately rebounds into the waiting hands of Rodak.   ", "        Nélson Semedo   Jonny Castro               78'  Jonny has been struggling to keep tabs on Kebano since the interval, and is now replaced by Semedo on the right flank. ", "  82'  The VAR will now check whether Sa was off his line when Mitrovic stuck the ball lfrom the penalty spot.   ", "  82'  The save stands! Sa's stop was within the rules according to the VAR, and Mitrovic won't have a second chance to take the penalty.   ", "        J. Stansfield   N. ", "        T. Cairney   Andreas Pereira               86'  Pereira is forced off due to an injury, and his replacement in the Fulham midfield will be Cairney.   ", "  88'  Under pressure in the six-yard box, following a header from Mitrovic, Decordova-Reid can't force the ball home past Sa. The Fulham winger then goes down injured and will receive medical attention.   ", "  90'  The game gets back under way, and Decordova-Reid returns from the touchline to a chorus of boos from the Wolves fans, who believe he was time-wasting with the clock running down.   ", "  90' + 1'  Seven minutes of stoppage time are declared by the fourth official, breathing new life into the home crowd. Can anyone snatch a winner in the time remaining?   ", "        T. Francois   K. Tete               90' + 2'  Fulham replace Tete for the final few minutes, and Francois comes on in his place.   ", "        K. Mbabu   B. De Cordova-Reid               90' + 3'  Silva's second stoppage-time switch sees Decordova-Reid make way for Mbabu.   ", "  90' + 4'  Gibbs-White and Mitrovic go head to head in the middle of the pitch, after a challenge between the pair, and a wider scuffle threatens to break out before the referee intervenes.   ", "        A. Mitrović   Yellow Card               90' + 5'  For tripping Gibbs-White and subsequently getting involved in an aggressive squabble, Mitrovic is booked deep into added time.   ", "        M. Gibbs-White   Yellow Card               90' + 5'  Gibbs-White sees yellow for confronting Mitrovic after a foul and butting heads with the Fulham forward.   ", "  90' + 7'  The VAR cross-checks the battle between Gibbs-White and Mitrovic, but quickly decides that neither man should be dismissed for their unseemly confrontation.   ", "  90' + 9'  FULL-TIME: WOLVES 0-0 FULHAM   ", '   Though not entirely uneventful, few moments of quality were to be seen in a goalless draw between two well-matched sides, and despite being the better team, Wolves may even be grateful for a point. A week on from his double strike against Liverpool, Mitrovic could only find the gloves of Sa with a potentially match-winning penalty, and the game then ambled towards its conclusion. Neither manager can argue too much with one point apiece.   ', "   With just a single point from their first two matches of the season, Wolves are faced with a tough trip to Tottenham next time out. Meanwhile, Fulham - who remain unbeaten, but still haven't broken their long winless streak in the Premier League (now 12 games) - will take on London rivals Brentford.   ", "   That's all from Molineux today, so thank you for joining us and goodbye!   "]

Commentary: ['   Hello and welcome to our live text commentary of this Premier League match between Manchester City and AFC Bournemouth at the Etihad Stadium.   ', "   City's quest to make it three Premier League titles in a row got off to a good start last week as they cruised to a 2-0 win away to West Ham United. Now the defending champions welcome newly promoted Bournemouth to Manchester for their first home game of the campaign, having lost just one such game in the last 22 seasons.   ", "   Bournemouth are already off the mark this season after picking up a 2-0 win of their own away to Aston Villa last week. While Scott Parker's Cherries face a far sterner test here, only two teams have won away from home against the reigning champions in the last 20 Premier League seasons. One was Parker's Fulham in 2020-21.   ", '   MANCHESTER CITY (4-3-3): Ederson; Kyle Walker, Ruben Dias, Nathan Ake, Joao Cancelo; Kevin de Bruyne, Rodri, Ilkay Gundogan (c); Riyad Mahrez, Erling Haaland, Phil Foden.   ', '   SUBS: Stefan Ortega Moreno, Rico Lewis, John Stones, Jack Grealish, Bernardo Silva, Luke Mbete, Josh Wilson-Esbrand, Julian Alvarez, Liam Delap.   ', '   AFC BOURNEMOUTH (3-4-3): Mark Travers; Jefferson Lerma, Chris Mepham, Lloyd Kelly (c); Adam Smith, Ben Pearson, Lewis Cook, Jack Stacey; Marcus Tavernier, Kieffer Moore, Ryan Christie.   ', '   SUBS: Siriki Dembele, Neto, Junior Stanislas, Jamal Lowe, Emiliano Marcondes, Philip Billing, Jaidon Anthony, Marcos Senesi, James Hill.   ', "   There's just one change to Pep Guardiola's City from their victory over West Ham. Mahrez takes Grealish's place in the front three.   ", "   Three new players come into Bournemouth's starting 11 from their game against Villa. Stacey, Christie and Cook get the nod from Parker.   ", "   On paper, this should be a comfortable City victory. The Citizens have won all 10 of their Premier League matches against Bournemouth, the best 100%-winning ratio by a team against another in Premier League history. In fact, the Cherries haven't won any of these sides' 16 league meetings historically. Anything other than a City win here would be a big shock.   ", "  1'  The visitors Bournemouth get this game underway!   ", "  2'  City start brightly, winning an early corner down their left. From the delivery, the former Bournemouth centre-back Ake heads wide.   ", "  4'  City are already dominating possession. The hosts force another corner down their right. This one's nodded off-target by Rodri.   ", "  5'  Mahrez runs onto a sliderule pass down the right and skips past Stacey, who scythes the Algerian down. That'll be a City free-kick.   ", "        J. Stacey   Yellow Card               5'  Stacey's booked for his early indiscretion. The Bournemouth left wing-back will have to watch himself now.   ", "  7'  Bournemouth manage to deal with the free-kick, but City aren't letting up. The champions win another corner as Ake's shot from the left of the box is blocked. De Bruyne swings it in and Mahrez's effort is too high.   ", "  9'  Chance for City! De Bruyne's shot from distance is blocked but the Belgian persists, sliding Foden into the box. Foden has two men to his right but ignores them, going for goal himself. Travers saves, and Haaland thumps the turf in frustration. City get a corner. They've been relentless since kick-off.   ", "  10'  Dias' header from the centre of the box from the corner is blocked. Bournemouth have barely been able to get out of their half so far.   ", "  12'  Gundogan wins a free-kick for City down their right as Christie impedes him. The resulting attack doesn't work out as the offside flag goes up.   ", "  14'  Bournemouth spot a brief opportunity to pass upfield, but Ake gets across to cut the throughball out.   ", "  16'  City are staying patient, passing the ball this way and that. Rodri attempts to pick out Mahrez with a crossfield pass that floats harmlessly out of play.   ", "        İ. Gündoğan   Goal               19'  GOAL! MANCHESTER CITY 1-0 AFC BOURNEMOUTH! It's been coming. Gundogan pulls off a cute backheel flick with his back to goal to lay the ball off to Haaland. The big Norwegian returns the favour to find Gundogan's dart into the box, and the German slots easily past Travers.   ", "        E. Haaland   Assist               20'  Haaland knew what Gundogan was up to and found him easily for the goal. Apparently Haaland's passing isn't great, but this goal proves that's nonsense.   ", "  20'  That's Gundogan's first goal of this nascent Premier League season. City have now scored in all of their last 11 Premier League games.   ", "  21'  City almost double their lead as Travers just beats Haaland to a ball over the top. Up the other end of the pitch, Bournemouth get their first shot of the game as Pearson's hopeful shot is saved by Ederson.   ", "  23'  City force Stacey to concede another corner. Bournemouth get some respite as Dias is too rough with Christie and fouls him.   ", "  25'  There's a brief break in play to allow the players to get water. It's a scorching day here in Manchester.   ", "  27'  Play resumes. Rodri curls not too wide from the edge of the box from Mahrez's cutback.   ", "  29'  Bournemouth make a rare foray upfield. Ake blocks a cross from the right to hand the visitors a corner.   ", "  30'  City handle Bournemouth's corner easily. The Cherries keep the ball in their own half before finding Smith down the right. Moore swipes at Smith's cross but can't make a firm connection with it.   ", "        K. De Bruyne   Goal               31'  GOAL! MANCHESTER CITY 2-0 AFC BOURNEMOUTH! Bournemouth get caught upfield and Foden finds De Bruyne. The Belgian drives inside from the right, performs a few stepovers, and pokes into the bottom left corner with the outside of his right foot. That's a delightful finish.   ", "        P. Foden   Assist               32'  This shows just how dangerous City are. You can either camp in your own half and get passed to death, or venture forward and get cut open as Foden did there to find De Bruyne. They're just too good for Bournemouth.   ", "  33'  De Bruyne's contributed to goals in his last three Premier League games now. The Belgian has been in a great vein of form since the end of last season.   ", "  35'  Haaland's a bit too eager to beat Lerma and fouls the defender in the process.   ", "        P. Foden   Goal               37'  GOAL! MANCHESTER CITY 3-0 AFC BOURNEMOUTH! De Bruyne skips inside on his right foot and rolls in Foden, whose shot has too much power for Travers to keep out. This game's already over as a contest.   ", "        K. De Bruyne   Assist               37'  What can Bournemouth do? This goal came just after they caused City a few problems and Smith had a shot blocked in the centre of City's box. City strode upfield and De Bruyne did the rest.   ", "  39'  That's four assists for De Bruyne in nine Premier League appearances against Bournemouth. He loves playing against the Cherries.   ", "  41'  Christie catches Gundogan with a high foot, leaving the German worse for wear. Play's stopped while the City man receives treatment.   ", "  43'  Tavernier wins a free-kick in his own half as he's caught by Cancelo.   ", "  45'  Haaland goes for goal on the volley from the left of the box. The shot's tipped out for a corner by Travers. There'll be at least four minutes added on before half-time.   ", "  45' + 2'  City are showing no signs of letting up before the break. Foden whips in a left-footed cross that Haaland dives to reach but can't make contact with.   ", "  45' + 3'  De Bruyne and Mahrez play a one-two to allow Mahrez to get near Bournemouth's corner flag. The Algerian can't prevent Bournemouth from getting a throw-in though.   ", "  45' + 4'  HALF-TIME: MANCHESTER CITY 3-0 AFC BOURNEMOUTH   ", "   City made light work of Bournemouth in that first half. Goals by Gundogan, De Bruyne, and Foden have put the defending champions in a commanding position. The Cherries have tried their best to cope with Guardiola's men, but City have barely put a foot wrong since kick-off.   ", "   City are unbeaten in their last 24 Premier League matches when leading at half-time, dating back to May last year against Brighton and Hove Albion. It's hard to see them not adding to their already comfortable lead in the second half. Interestingly, Haaland had just five touches of the ball in the opening 45 minutes.   ", "        J. Grealish   P. Foden               46'  City make a half-time substitution. Grealish replaces Foden.   ", "  46'  City get the second half started. Let's see if they're as dominant as they were in the first.   ", "  48'  City are getting back to where they left off, popping the ball around without a care in the world. All Bournemouth can do is shuttle from side to side and try to keep their shape.   ", "  50'  De Bruyne's first-time cross from a centre-right position bounces out of play.   ", "  52'  Grealish's cutback from the byline is cut out. The assistant's flag goes up anyway.   ", "  54'  Ederson claims a routine cross into City's box from Smith. The tempo of the game has definitely slowed, unsurprisingly given the scoreline and the heat.   ", "  55'  Chance for City! De Bruyne races onto Gundogan's around-the-corner pass to shoot straight at Travers at his near post. The Bournemouth goalkeeper does his job and keeps the shot out.   ", "  56'  City keep the pressure on following a few corners and Mahrez spanks a volley into a defender's midriff. Grealish is tugged down by Mepham.   ", "        C. Mepham   Yellow Card               57'  Mepham's booked for halting Grealish's dribble. City now have a free-kick in a central position, too far out to shoot from.   ", "  58'  De Bruyne lets fly from the edge of the box. The shot's always rising and is at no risk of testing Travers.   ", "  60'  Mahrez jinks inside from the right of the box and finds Gundogan just outside the D. Gundogan's curling shot is off-target.   ", "  62'  City are getting close to breaking Bournemouth down again. Seconds after Travers tips Mahrez's long-range effort wide, Haaland can't reach Walker's cross. Cancelo picks up the pieces, carries the ball inside, and has a shot closed down.   ", "        J. Stanislas   R. Christie               63'  Bournemouth make their first substitutions of the game. Stanislas comes on for Christie first.   ", "        P. Billing   L. Cook               63'  Cook heads off too. Billing takes his place on the pitch for Bournemouth.   ", "        J. Stones   Rúben Dias               64'  City make a few more changes too with the game already won. Stones replaces Dias at centre-back.   ", "        Bernardo Silva   İ. Gündoğan               65'  Gundogan heads off next. Silva takes his place at the heart of City's midfield.   ", "  67'  Play pauses for another water break after Bournemouth defend a City corner. The fans in the Etihad Stadium are having great fun.   ", "  69'  City pull off a few more passing triangles. Grealish can't master Silva's dipping cross from deep to the right of goal, jarring his foot in the process. The City midfielder stays down and gets checked over by the physios.   ", "  71'  Grealish is thankfully back on his feet and back on the pitch.   ", "  73'  Haaland surprisingly scuffs wide from the centre of the box from Grealish's pass. That'll be the City forward's last act of the game.   ", "        J. Álvarez   E. Haaland               74'  Haaland walks off to applause from the City fans. Alvarez takes his place up front.   ", "  76'  Smith pushes the tricky Grealish over to give a free-kick away.   ", "  78'  Bournemouth haven't attempted a shot in this second half yet. City have got things well under control.   ", "        J. Lerma   Own Goal               79'  GOAL! MANCHESTER CITY 4-0 AFC BOURNEMOUTH! Cancelo twists this way and that down the left and drills a cross into the six-yard box. It ricochets off the unfortunate Lerma into his own net.   ", "        M. Senesi   M. Tavernier               80'  Bournemouth substitution. Their Argentine defender Senesi replaces Tavernier.   ", "        R. Lewis   K. Walker               82'  City substitution. The 17-year-old Lewis replaces Walker.   ", "  84'  Stanislas fires not far wide from outside the box. City earn a corner down their right. Senesi heads it away from goal. This game is clearly winding down.   ", "  86'  Mahrez's left-footed delivery into the box doesn't find a teammate.   ", "  88'  Ake and Moore stay down after a bruising but fair tussle for the ball.   ", "        J. Lowe   K. Moore               90'  Bournemouth take Moore off with their last change. Lowe goes up front for added time. There'll be at least three minutes of it.   ", "        A. Smith   Yellow Card               90' + 1'  Smith blatantly shoves Cancelo in the face to stop the City full-back from getting past him. It's an obvious yellow card offence.   ", "  90' + 3'  FULL-TIME: MANCHESTER CITY 4-0 AFC BOURNEMOUTH   ", "   City have cruised to an easy victory against new boys Bournemouth. The Citizens got the job done with three first-half goals. Lerma's unfortunate own goal added gloss to their victory in the second half. Bournemouth were no match for the defending champions. There's no shame in that.   ", "   City's four-goal haul takes them top of the early Premier League table for now, ahead of Arsenal on goal difference. They've yet to concede a goal and will take some stopping again this season. Bournemouth drop to ninth, having attempted just three shots here. Their season won't be judged on games like this.   ", "   It's two wins in two for City, then, who've made a strong start to their Premier League defence. They'll have tougher tests to come. That's all for now. Goodbye!   "]

Commentary: ['   Hello and welcome to live coverage of the Premier League meeting between Brighton and Hove Albion and Newcastle United at the Amex Stadium!   ', '   Brighton are playing their first home game of the season after making a winning start to their campaign, earning their first ever victory at Old Trafford after beating Manchester United 2-1. Newcastle also got off to a winning start against newly-promoted Nottingham Forest with a 2-0 win the day after Eddie Howe signed his new long-term contract with the club.   ', '   BRIGHTON AND HOVE ALBION STARTING XI (3-5-1-1): Robert Sanchez; Joel Veltman, Lewis Dunk, Adam Webster; Solly March, Pascal Gross, Alexis Mac Allister, Moises Caicedo, Leandro Trossard; Adam Lallana; Danny Welbeck.   ', '   BRIGHTON AND HOVE ALBION SUBS: Tariq Lamptey, Jan-Paul van Hecke, Jason Steele, Kaoru Mitoma, Deniz Undav, Levi Samuels Colwill, Enock Mwepu, Steven Alzate, Jeremy Sarmiento.   ', '   NEWCASTLE UNITED STARTING XI (4-3-3): Nick Pope; Kieran Trippier, Fabian Schar, Sven Botman, Dan Burn; Joe Willock, Bruno Guimaraes, Joelinton; Miguel Almiron, Callum Wilson, Allan Saint-Maximin.   ', '   NEWCASTLE UNITED SUBS: Jacob Murphy, Sean Longstaff, Matt Ritchie, Chris Wood, Martin Dubravka, Elliot Anderson, Jamaal Lascelles, Paul Dummett, Javier Manquillo.   ', "   After an impressive performance against Manchester United, Graham Potter sticks with the same starting line-up from last weekend, with Trossard and March providing the width as Lallana sits behind Welbeck in support. There's no Neal Maupay in the squad amid talks about his future.   ", "   There's just one change from Howe to the side that beat Nottingham Forest last time out, and it's an enforced one. Matt Targett is missing from the squad, so Botman comes in to make his debut. He slots in at centre-back, which means a move out to left-back for Burn, who is back at his former club.   ", '   Brighton have never lost a home Premier League game against Newcastle in five previous meetings (W2 D3), only facing West Ham as often without losing at the Amex Stadium in the competition.   ', '   The teams are out on the pitch now, with kick-off just moments away!   ', "  1'  Wilson gets the game underway for Newcastle!   ", "  2'  Newcastle have made a bright start and are trying to put Brighton on the backfoot early on here. Burn tries to slide it through to Wilson, but it bounces over his head and out near the byline.   ", "  4'  It was a good switch from Gross out to Trossard on the left and he shuffles past Trippier before deciding to go for goal himself from range. It takes a big deflection off Almiron on the way through which helps it wide.   ", "  6'  Brighton are onto their third corner in quick succession as they try to force it through Newcastle's backline. Gross whips this one in and it's well dealt with between Burn and Saint-Maximin.   ", "  8'  Newcastle are struggling to get out of their own half at the moment as Brighton push forward again. Trossard gets the better of Trippier to curl in a cross, but Schar is in the way of it.   ", "  10'  It's a great tackle from Veltman to dispossess Wilson on the edge of the box and he sets Brighton on the counter. March tries to slide it through to Lallana but overhits it straight out of play.   ", "  12'  Following a 2-1 victory in March, Newcastle are looking to secure consecutive league wins over Brighton for the first time since beating them twice in the 2016-17 Championship campaign.   ", "  14'  NO GOAL! Trippier's free-kick is only half-cleared by Brighton, and it's worked back into Wilson. On the turn, he gets his foot up to control the ball before firing it across goal, but the whistle had already gone after he nearly caught Dunk with the high boot.   ", "  16'  Newcastle are moving the ball quicker when they win it back now and Willock tries to switch it out to Joelinton in space on the opposite flank. He scuffs as it though and it's an easy clearance for Veltman.   ", "  18'  Sanchez goes long for March and Burn is caught out as it sails over his head. March has acres of space to run into, but the defender is let off by the offside flag.   ", "  20'  GOOD SAVE! Trossard skips past Trippier and darts down the left before pulling it back from the byline. It hits Pope and bounces up kindly for Welbeck, but the keeper reacts well to push it off his head.   ", "        A. Saint-Maximin   Yellow Card               22'  Saint-Maximin was ready to skip into the box when Mac Allister stuck out a leg, but the midfielder pulled out of the challenge. The Frenchman throws himself to ground and he's booked for diving.   ", "  24'  Trippier is down for Newcastle and receiving treatment, which is the cue for the players to take their cooling break. The right-back is okay to carry on.   ", "  26'  CHANCE! A poor clearance by Dunk is latched onto by Joelinton and he quickly sets Saint-Maximin away. He squares it across the edge of the box to Almiron, but he fires his first-time shot high into the stands.   ", "  28'  There's a slight delay to Pope taking a goal-kick due to a disturbance among the Newcastle fans. It's quickly dealt with by officials though and play is able to get back underway.   ", "  30'  There are shouts for a penalty for a handball against Schar from the Brighton fans and players. His arm was tight to his side and it hit him from close range, so the referee waves the claims away.   ", "  32'  Gross curls a low cross into the box and Welbeck goes to volley it on the penalty spot. Schar stoops to clear it, and takes a kick to the head for his trouble, with Newcastle getting the free-kick.   ", "  33'  OFF THE LINE! Gross drills a low cross into the middle and Welbeck misses it, but the clearance goes straight to March. His low shot pinballs through the box and past Pope, but Trippier has two attempts to clear it away.   ", "        A. Mac Allister   Yellow Card               34'  Newcastle were attempting to break on the counter, and Mac Allister dragged Almiron back to stop him and earns himself a booking.   ", "  36'  Saint-Maximin's run is cut out by Veltman and the defender takes matters into his own hands by driving upfield. He squares it to Lallana on the edge of the box, but his shot is blocked.   ", "  38'  Brighton are keeping the pressure on here and the space opens up for Caicedo outside the box. He curls a powerful effort on goal, but it's straight down the middle at Pope.   ", "  40'  Joelinton pushes his way through midfield before Wilson takes over and spreads it out to Willock. He tries to drill a low shot across goal, but a deflection helps it loop in Sanchez's gloves.   ", "  42'  SAVE! Gross catches out Newcastle's defence by pulling it back to Lallana on the penalty spot instead of whipping in a cross. He spins and hits the shot on the half-volley, but it's straight at Pope.   ", "  44'  Trippier slides it through to Saint-Maximin and he leaves Webster on the floor as he cuts inside. It's a poor pullback towards Wilson though and Dunk clears his lines.   ", "  45' + 1'  GOOD SAVE! Almiron beats Webster to the ball and slides it through to Wilson. He turns, but can't sort his feet out quickly enough and Sanchez makes himself big to smother it.   ", "  45' + 3'  HALF-TIME: BRIGHTON AND HOVE ALBION 0-0 NEWCASTLE UNITED.   ", "   It's goalless at the break between Brighton and Newcastle. The hosts had the better of the first-half chances and had most of the ball across the line before Trippier made a last-ditch clearance to keep the score level and deny March. Caicedo and Lallana both had chances saved by Pope. Wilson did have the ball in the back of the net, but it was disallowed for a high boot by the forward.   ", "   Potter's side were bright in the first half, getting into some dangerous positions, but their end product was lacking at times, so he'll be hoping that can improve after the break. Newcastle have seen slightly more of the ball, but their best chances came on the counter.   ", "  46'  Brighton get us back underway for the second half!   ", "  48'  The hosts have made a bright start to the game with Trossard darting down the left before squaring it to Lallana on the edge of the box. He tries to return the favour, but the Belgian isn't on the same wavelength and the chance is gone.   ", "  50'  GREAT SAVE! It's a brilliant cross in from March on the right and Lallana peels off the back of Dunk to get his head to it. He thumps it on goal and Pope stretches to push it wide from close range.   ", "  52'  Newcastle just can't get out as Brighton continue their bright start to the second half. Joelinton loses out to Caicedo, who quickly touches it through to Welbeck, but his first touch gets away from him.   ", "  54'  Brighton neatly work it from left to right and back again, but Newcastle have dropped deep into their shape to block off the space ahead of them.   ", "  56'  Veltman goes long down the right again and March is chasing down the throughball. Pope comes a long way out of his box and gets there ahead of the winger to clear his lines in time.   ", "  57'  Tempers have well and truly boiled over after a coming together between Joelinton and March. The Brazilian really isn't happy, and he starts the pushing, which prompts everyone else to get involved before the referee can calm things down.   ", "        Joelinton   Yellow Card               58'  The referee pulls both players aside and gives them a warning for the argument. Joelinton goes into the book.   ", "        S. March   Yellow Card               58'  And so does March for his involvement.   ", "  60'  Newcastle are just trying to get a foothold in this game after being on the backfoot for most of the second half so far. Guimaraes manages to spin out of trouble in the middle, but can't pick out Wilson with a throughball. Commentary: ['   Hello and welcome to live commentary of this Premier League fixture between Arsenal and Leicester City. The hosts enter this one on a high: they come into this one following a 2-0 victory away at Crystal Palace to start the season, and they’ll be looking to maintain a 100 per cent record today.   ', '   Leicester, meanwhile, arrive in London following a 2-2 draw with Brentford. Manager, Brendan Rodgers, would have been upset with his side surrendering a 2-0 lead in that game, and he’ll be expecting a reaction against a tough Arsenal team today.   ', '   ARSENAL (4-3-3): Aaron Ramsdale; Ben White, William Saliba, Gabriel Magalhaes, Oleksandr Zinchenko; Martin Odegaard, Thomas Partey, Granit Xhaka; Bukayo Saka, Gabriel Jesus, Gabriel Martinelli.   ', '   SUBS: Kieran Tierney, Nicolas Pepe, Eddie Nketiah, Emile Smith Rowe, Takehiro Tomiyasu, Matt Turner, Albert Sambi Lokonga, Mohamed Elneny, Rob Holding.   ', '   LEICESTER CITY (3-5-1-1): Danny Ward; Wesley Fofana, Jonny Evans, Daniel Amartey; Timothy Castagne, Youri Tielemans, Wilfred Ndidi, Kiernan Dewsbury-Hall, James Justin; James Maddison; Jamie Vardy.   ', '   SUBS: Dennis Praet, Ayoze Perez, Kelechi Iheanacho, Daniel Iversen, Caglar Soyuncu, Marc Albrighton, Luke Thomas, Nampalys Mendy, Patson Daka.   ', '   Arsenal are unchanged following their 2-0 victory over Palace.   ', '   Leicester also opt for continuity as they name the same starting line-up that began against Brentford.   ', '   The visitors will be looking to correct their poor away record today. Leicester have kept one clean sheet in their last 26 away Premier League matches, doing so in a 2-0 win at Burnley last March. They haven’t kept a clean sheet on the road against a current top-flight side since February 2021, a goalless draw at Wolves.   ', '   The players are emerging from the tunnel and kick off is just seconds away!   ', "  1'  Leicester kick off the first half.   ", "  3'  Jesus looks to chase down Xhaka's long pass over the top, but Evans holds firm to shield it out of play.   ", "  5'  SAVE! Ramsdale makes a big save early on. ", "  90' + 7'  FULL-TIME: ARSENAL 4-2 LEICESTER CITY   ", '   A sensational display from Jesus powers Arsenal to an impressive 4-2 victory. ", "  90' + 9'  FULL-TIME: ASTON VILLA 2-1 EVERTON   ", '   Aston Villa get all three points today, after a thrilling end to the second half that almost saw Everton come from behind to nick a point. Commentary: ['   Hello and welcome to live coverage of the Premier League meeting between Chelsea and Tottenham at Stamford Bridge!   ', "   Antonio Conte returns to Stamford Bridge on the back of a winning start to the season, with Spurs coming from behind to record a comfortable 4-1 victory over Southampton last Saturday. Chelsea also started their campaign with three points, but in a much tighter game as Jorginho's first-half penalty helped them edge to a 1-0 win over Everton.   ", "   CHELSEA STARTING XI (3-4-2-1): Edouard Mendy; Reece James, Thiago Silva, Kalidou Koulibaly; Ruben Loftus-Cheek, N'Golo Kante, Jorginho, Marc Cucurella; Mason Mount, Kai Havertz; Raheem Sterling.   ", '   CHELSEA SUBS: Trevoh Chalobah, Callum Hudson-Odoi, Cesar Azpilicueta, Conor Gallagher, Armando Broja, Kepa Arrizabalaga, Hakim Ziyech, Ben Chilwell, Christian Pulisic.   ', '   TOTTENHAM STARTING XI (3-4-2-1): Hugo Lloris; Christian Romero, Eric Dier, Ben Davies; Emerson Royal, Rodrigo Bentancur, Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg, Ryan Sessegnon; Dejan Kulusevski, Son Heung-Min; Harry Kane.   ', '   TOTTENHAM SUBS: Yves Bissouma, Fraser Forster, Bryan Gil, Ivan Perisic, Matt Doherty, Lucas Moura, Davinson Sanchez, Japhet Tanganga, Richarlison.   ', '   Thomas Tuchel makes two changes to the side that beat Everton last Saturday, switching both wing-backs. Loftus-Cheek and Cucurella, who makes his full Chelsea debut today, are both brought in, with Chilwell and Azpilicueta dropping to the bench. Koulibaly is okay to start after going off with cramp in that game.   ', "   Conte was clearly impressed with his team's performance in last week's win over Southampton as he sticks with the same side here. Richarlison is available among the subs today after serving a ban on the opening weekend.   ", '   Spurs have won just one of their last 37 away matches against Chelsea in all competitions (D12 L24); a 3-1 win in April 2018 in the Premier League.   ', '   The teams are out on the pitch now, with kick-off just moments away!   ', "  1'  Sterling gets the game underway for Chelsea!   ", "  2'  Chelsea's attack is broken down and Spurs break quickly on the counter. Kulusevski has options on either side and chooses to go left for Son, but he's crowded off it by James and Silva.   ", "  4'  Chelsea just can't get out of their own half at the moment as Bentancur cuts out Cucurella's clearance. He slides it through to Son, who hits the shot on the turn, but Silva gets in the way of it.   ", "  6'  Spurs' high press is causing Chelsea some difficulty early on here, but the hosts play themselves out of trouble this time. Koulibaly goes long looking for Havertz, but overhits it straight out.   ", "  8'  It's a good cross from Loftus-Cheek on the right, but Davies glances it away. He gets it as far as Cucurella, whose drilled shot is blocked by Dier. Jorginho works it back out to Kante on the wing, but his cross evades everyone.   ", "  10'  Since losing consecutive Premier League games against Spurs in 2018, Chelsea are unbeaten in seven games against their London rivals (W6 D1), conceding only one goal in that run.   ", "  12'  Loftus-Cheek cleverly flicks it past Sessegnon and the space opens up for Chelsea in behind. He touches it into James, who threads it through to Mount, but he's blocked off by Davies.   ", "  14'  James takes a free-kick short to Mount and he's looking for Sterling with his clipped cross. It's congested in Spurs' box and an offside flag goes up just before it's cleared.   ", "  16'  Chelsea work it down their right again and Havertz lays it off to Kante, who knocks it through Bentancur's legs before having a go from the edge of the box. There's a lot of power on it, but Dier makes a good block.   ", "  18'  Jorginho's floated cross is too high for Havertz and Romero heads it away as far as Koulibaly on the edge of the box. He lets it bounce before hitting the shot, but it flies wide of the far post.   ", "  19'  GOOD SAVE! Sterling has Romero tight to him, but he manages to flick it back to Havertz who is following in. He takes it first time, fizzing it towards the far post and Lloris tips it wide.   ", "        K. Koulibaly   Goal               19'  KOULIBALY SCORES! From the resulting corner, Chelsea lead! It's a great cross from Cucurella, and Koulibaly is in acres of space next to the penalty spot. He watches it drop and hits the shot on the volley. Sterling ducks out the way of it and Lloris has no chance of stopping it. 1-0 Chelsea!   ", "        Marc Cucurella   Assist               19'  Cucurella spots that Koulibaly isn't being marked and picks him out with a great cross from the corner.   ", "  21'  Spurs are enjoying a good spell of possession after the restart, but it's all in their own half. Chelsea are pressing them high up the field and making it difficult for them to get forward.   ", "  22'  GOOD SAVE! Chelsea are caught out by a long ball over the top from Hojbjerg to Sessegnon, and he curves his run to stay onside. The angle is closing down as the defenders flood back and Mendy rushes out to smother his low shot.   ", "  24'  Loftus-Cheek's low cross deflects to Son and he spins before trying to slide it through to Kane for the counter. Jorginho sticks out a leg to make an important interception just in time.   ", "  26'  CHANCE! Another corner for Chelsea sees Mount whip in the cross and Dier's header at the near post goes straight to the unmarked Koulibaly. He goes for the acrobatic effort this time, but his volley sails high over the bar.   ", "  28'  The players make their way to the sidelines for the first cooling break of the game and the managers are using the opportunity to get their messages across.   ", "  30'  Sterling cuts inside from the left and curls a shot towards goal, but there are a lot of bodies between him and the net. There are some shouts for a handball against Hojbjerg, but there was nothing in it.   ", "  32'  Chelsea win another set-piece on the left and Cucurella curls it in. The delivery isn't as good this time though as Romero clears it at the near post.   ", "  34'  Kante is quickly being closed down so he decides to go long this time, playing it down the right for Sterling. There's a lot on it and Lloris rushes out to the edge of his box to collect it.   ", "  36'  Spurs have come back to win four of the 10 previous Premier League games in which they've conceded first under Antonio Conte (D1 L5).   ", "  38'  Chelsea work it quickly upfield again and Mount knocks it past Kulusevski as he cuts inside for the left before having a go from range. There's no curl on it though and it flies high and wide of the far corner.   ", "  40'  Mount swings another corner in from the right and all of the Chelsea players peel away to the far post. There's not enough on the cross and Dier easily deals with it.   ", "        R. James   Yellow Card               41'  Son is breaking quickly on the counter and James reaches around him to stop the run. He's shown the first yellow card of the game.   ", "  43'  Son tries to break away after another poor corner for Chelsea, but he runs straight into traffic this time. The hosts are making it really difficult for Spurs' front three to get into the game.   ", "  45'  Jorginho has time to get his head up and he curls a wonderful cross towards the far post. Loftus-Cheek is just inches away from getting his head on it, and that was a great chance for Chelsea!   ", "  45' + 2'  It's threaded through to Sterling and he has Romero against his back, but he still manages to backheel it onto Havertz. The space opens up ahead of him, but Dier slides in with a vital block.   ", "  45' + 4'  HALF-TIME: CHELSEA 1-0 TOTTENHAM.   ", "   Koulibaly's first Chelsea goal gives the Blues a 1-0 lead over Spurs at half-time. The hosts dominated the majority of the first half and took the lead when two new signings linked up. Cucurella swung in the corner and Koulibaly rifled in the volley. Just before that, Havertz also had a good chance that Lloris tipped wide. Spurs' only chance of note fell to Sessegnon, who saw his effort smothered by Mendy.   ", "   Tuchel will be pleased with his side's performance so far, but they could've been further ahead with better quality into the box. As for Spurs, the front three have struggled to make any impact so far. Conte will be looking for a way to change that as they look to get back into this match.   ", "  46'  Spurs get us back underway for the second half!   ", "  48'  GOOD SAVE! Spurs are moving it upfield much quicker already than in the first half and Kane curls it in behind James to pick out Son. He's forced wide with the bounce but gets the shot away and Mendy makes himself big to stop it.   ", "  50'  The cross bounces away from Havertz, but Dier can only scuff his clearance to Mount on the edge of the box. He squares it to James, who drills a first-time shot on goal, but it's blocked by Davies.   ", "  52'  Chelsea haven't lost at home in the Premier League when leading at half-time since October 2011 vs Arsenal (W78 D18 since then).   ", "  54'  SAVE! Son is caught on the ball inside his own box by Sterling and he bundles the ball back to Mount on the left. It looks like he's crossing it, but it's swerving in, and Lloris takes no chances as he helps it onto the roof of the net.   ", "  56'  Spurs struggle to clear another Chelsea corner into the box and it falls to Cucurella on the edge of the box. He runs onto it, striking it first time, but Bentancur is in the right place.   ", "        Richarlison   R. Sessegnon               57'  Spurs are making the first change of the game as they look to find an equaliser. Sessegnon makes way for Richarlison, who makes his Tottenham debut.   ", "  59'  Chelsea are slow to close down Emerson as he darts forward down the right and he swings a dangerous cross onto the edge of the six-yard box. Kane is caught on his heels though and Cucurella hooks it away.   ", "  61'  GREAT CHANCES! Sterling blazes a shot over the bar for Chelsea and Spurs go straight down the other end, with Hojbjerg picking out Kane. He peels off the back of the defender and hits the shot just before he slips, dragging it wide of the far post.   ", "        É. Mendy   Yellow Card               62'  Mendy is taking too long over the goal-kick in the referee's opinion, so he's booked for time-wasting.   ", "  64'  Spurs have their first corner of the game, but a poor cross from Son sees them win another in quick succession. This one is deeper, but it sails over everyone and Sterling breaks on the counter.   ", "  66'  Chelsea work it down their right again and after playing a clever one-two with Loftus-Cheek, Sterling clips a cross in from the byline. It's over everyone though and Emerson hooks it away.   ", "        P. Højbjerg   Goal               68'  HOJBJERG EQUALISES! Jorginho loses the ball inside his own box, and Davies touches it to Hojbjerg. He keeps his shot low as he drills it through the crowd of bodies in the box, and Mendy sees it late so can do nothing to stop it from nestling into the bottom corner. 1-1!   ", "        B. Davies   Assist               68'  Davies was waiting in the six-yard box when Son nicks it off Jorginho, and he just touches it into Hojbjerg's feet.   ", "  69'  That goal has sparked fury among the Chelsea backroom staff as Conte raced over to their bench to celebrate in front of them. Tuchel already wasn't happy with a challenge on Havertz earlier in the move and he's having to be dragged away.   ", "        Yellow Card      71'  Tempers boiled over for both sets of staff and some of the players on the bench, but Tuchel and Conte have both been shown a yellow card for their part in the argument.   ", "        César Azpilicueta   Jorginho               73'  Chelsea are making their first change following Spurs' goal and it's Jorginho that's going off for Azpilicueta.   ", "  75'  WHAT A CHANCE! James bursts down the right and Son doesn't close him down so he whips a pacy cross into the six-yard box. Havertz makes a run between the two defenders and tries to sidefoot it past Lloris, but hits it into the stands.   ", "        R. James   Goal               77'  JAMES SCORES! Kulusevski is caught on the ball and Spurs just can't get back into their shape in time. Sterling sets himself to take a shot from the edge of the D but slides it through to James, who has acres of space in the box. He hits the shot first time, firing it past Lloris into the back of the net. 2-1 Chelsea!   ", "        R. Sterling   Assist               77'  Kante slides it through to Sterling and he thinks about taking the shot before realising James is in a much better position.   ", "  78'  Tuchel is receiving another warning from the fourth official after sprinting past Spurs' bench and down the touchline after the goal was scored.   ", "        I. Perišić   Son Heung-Min               79'  Spurs' are making a double change in response to going behind again. Son is the first to go off, with Perisic replacing him.   ", "        Y. Bissouma   R. Bentancur               79'  And Bentancur is the other player making way, with Bissouma on in his place.   ", "  81'  Spurs are putting Chelsea under pressure as they look for their second equaliser of the game. They win another corner, but Perisic hits it straight against Havertz at the near post.   ", "        Lucas Moura   Emerson               82'  Final roll of the dice for Spurs now and it's an attacking one as Lucas comes on in place of Emerson.   ", "  83'  Chelsea have a problem here as Kante has stayed down holding his knee after getting in a tangle with Bissouma. He's receiving treatment now, but the physio gestures to the bench that a change needs to be made.   ", "        C. Gallagher   N. Kanté               84'  And Kante does go straight off the pitch, with Gallagher replacing him.   ", "  85'  MISS! James bursts forward down the right and pulls a great cross back to Gallagher just inside the box. Romero is in front of him so he helps it onto Mount, who drags his shot wide of the near post.   ", "        C. Pulišić   R. Sterling               85'  Chelsea are actually going to make a double change here. Sterling is the first to be taken off, with Pulisic coming on for him.   ", "        K. Havertz   Yellow Card               86'  Havertz barges into Romero in an attempt to get the ball and then squares up to the defender when the foul goes against him. He's shown a yellow card.   ", "  88'  Havertz and Romero are still getting involved with each other and the referee steps in to split them up again after the German doesn't get the throw-in he thought should've gone his way.   ", "        A. Broja   K. Havertz               90'  Havertz is taking his time leaving the field and the referee is hurrying him along. Broja comes on for the last few minutes.   ", "  90' + 2'  Only Mount (27) has been involved in more Premier League goals under Tuchel than James (15).   ", "  90' + 4'  GREAT SAVE! It's a dangerous corner in from Perisic and Dier's flick-on hits Silva before looping towards goal and Mendy tips it over. In the middle of that, VAR is checking an incident where Romero dragged Cucurella by his hair, but nothing is done.   ", "        H. Kane   Goal               90' + 6'  KANE EQUALISES! Spurs have come back again! It's another good delivery from Pulisic and this time, Kane isn't picked up as he moves towards the near post. He leaps highest and glances his header on. Mendy is static on his line and can't stop it from hitting the bottom corner. 2-2!   ", "        I. Perišić   Assist               90' + 6'  Perisic goes for the in-swinger on this one, and he picks out a great cross to the near post for Kane.   ", "  90' + 8'  FULL-TIME: CHELSEA 2-2 TOTTENHAM.   ", "        Red Card      90' + 8'  Conte shook Tuchel's hand on his way out of the technical area, and the Chelsea manager refused to let go, pulling him into another argument. They have to be split up by officials again, and this time, they both see red from the referee.   ", "   Kane snatches a point for Spurs with a stoppage-time header in a 2-2 draw with Chelsea. The Blues were in control in the first half and Koulibaly rifled them ahead with a brilliant volley from a corner. Spurs' equaliser came out of nowhere, with Jorginho losing the ball in his own box and Hojbjerg drilling it in. It looked like James had sealed the points with his strike, but Kane glanced in a corner in the 96th minute to earn the draw. Tempers boiled over in the second half though, with both managers being shown a red card for another argument after the final whistle.   ", '   That draw sees both teams move onto four points in the table. Next up for Chelsea is a trip to Leeds United, while Tottenham host Wolves next weekend.   ', "   That's all for today, goodbye!
