Commentary: ['   Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the Premier League clash between Nottingham Forest and West Ham United at the City Ground.   ', "   Nottingham Forest began life back in the Premier League with a tough defeat to Newcastle United on the road. Goals from Fabian Schar and Callum Wilson punished the newly-promoted side at the back, and there will be pressure on Forest to deliver a response. Steve Cooper's men continue to be active in the transfer market, but it may take time for the new players to settle in. Cooper will want results quickly to avoid a slow start to life back in the top flight.   ", "   West Ham also suffered a defeat in their first game of the new season. They were on the receiving end of Erling Haaland's first two Premier League as Manchester City eased past the Hammers at the London Stadium. David Moyes' men were not completely outplayed and did have their moments, but he will be urging his team to respond after the setback and have a good chance to find their form today.   ", "   NOTTINGHAM FOREST (3-4-3): Dean Henderson; Joe Worrall, Moussa Niakhate, Scott McKenna; Neco Williams, Lewis O'Brien, Orel Mangala, Harry Toffolo; Brennan Johnson, Jesse Lingard, Taiwo Awoniyi.   ", '   NOTTINGHAM FOREST SUBS: Wayne Hennessey, Giulian Biancone, Steve Cook, Loic Mbe Soh, Sam Surridge, Alex Mighten, Cafu, Lyle Taylor, Oliver Hammond.   ', '   WEST HAM (4-2-3-1): Lukasz Fabianski; Vladimir Coufal, Kurt Zouma, Ben Johnson, Aaron Cresswell; Tomas Soucek, Declan Rice; Jarrod Bowen, Said Benrahma, Pablo Fornals; Michail Antonio.   ', '   WEST HAM SUBS: Alphonse Areola, Gianluca Scamacca, Manuel Lanzini, Flynn Downes, Maxwel Cornet, Conor Coventry, Harrison Ashby, Darren Randolph.   ', '   Forest have made two changes to their side from their defeat to Newcastle. Colback and Surridge drop out of the starting line-up and are replaced by Mangala and Awoniyi, who both make their first starts for the club. Lingard is part of a three-man attack against one of his former clubs.   ', '   West Ham have made one change to their side that lost to Manchester City last time out. Benrahma comes into the side in the final third to replace Lanzini, who drops to the bench. Fabianski is fit enough to retain his place between the posts after being forced off against City.   ', '   This is the first meeting between Nottingham Forest and West Ham United in any competition since January 2014, when Forest won 5-0 in an FA Cup tie at the City Ground.   ', "  1'  We're under way at the City Ground.   ", "  2'  Toffolo sends Awoniyi down the left flank and he wins a corner off the legs of Zouma, who walks gingerly away from the challenge.   ", "  4'  Williams almost allows Bowen to break out of the West Ham half to ease the pressure, but he gets back to put in a good challenge on the winger.   ", "  5'  Former Forest striker Antonio receives a few jeers for his first touch. He fends off McKenna, but cannot find Bowen with his offload down the right flank.   ", "  5'  Awoniyi drives forward at the West Ham defence and wins a free-kick in a good position for the hosts in the final third.   ", "  6'  Williams gets his delivery all wrong, blasting his cross - or perhaps even a very ambitious shot - well over the bar.   ", "  7'  Antonio turns and is brought down by O'Brien in a decent position for the Hammers. Cresswell will line up the resulting free-kick.   ", "  8'  OVER! Cresswell goes for a curling strike towards the top-left corner, but his effort travels just over the bar.   ", "        D. Rice   Yellow Card               9'  Rice brings down Lingard on the charge, pulling back his arm. The England man goes into the book.   ", "  10'  SAVE! Williams' free-kick causes problems in the box for the visitors and Worrall keeps the attack alive by feeding Mangala. He clips a cross to the back post for Niakhate to attack. The defender challenges with Bowen, who directs a header towards his own goal, forcing Fabianski to turn the ball behind for a corner on the stretch.   ", "  12'  Forest attack again down the right flank and O'Brien's cross is flicked on to Awoniyi. He nods towards goal, but his effort lacks the power to trouble Fabianski.   ", "  13'  CHANCE! Williams has space and time on the right flank and he floats a dangerous cross into the middle. Awoniyi rises between Zouma and Cresswell, but nods his effort wide of the left post. That was a great opportunity for Awoniyi.   ", "  14'  Williams angles a dangerous throughball for the run of Awoniyi behind the West Ham defence. It just evades the boot of the forward and rolls into the grasp of Fabianski.   ", "  16'  CLOSE! Benrahma cuts in from the left flank and angles a strike towards the bottom-right corner that Henderson has to push away. It strikes the covering Toffolo and bounces towards goal, but the defender recovers and clears it behind.   ", "  18'  Cresswell has space down the left flank and curls a cross to the near post for Antonio to attack, but it evades the boot of the forward and bounces into Henderson's hands.   ", "  20'  Johnson presses Cresswell down the flank and wins the ball for Lingard to collect on the edge of the box. He fires a low ball across the face of goal, but Awoniyi cannot reach it on the stretch.   ", "  22'  The game has been played a rapid tempo in the opening 22 minutes. It has been end-to-end football that is just lacking a clinical edge from the two sides.   ", "  23'  Johnson charges down the left flank and looks for space to pick out Awoniyi in the middle, but he sends his cross straight at Fabianski.   ", "  24'  CHANCE! Cresswell has time to pick his spot and send a cross to the back post. Soucek comes in unmarked, only to direct his header into the ground and at Henderson.   ", "  25'  The game is paused for a cooling break.   ", "  26'  We're back under way after the cooling break.   ", "  29'  SAVE! Lingard works the ball into Johnson, who turns inside down the inside-left channel. He opens up his body to curl a strike at goal, but its straight a Fabianski.   ", "  30'  Coufal pushes forward from the back for the Hammers and goes for goal from distance, only to drag his effort harmlessly wide of the target.   ", "  32'  BLOCK! ", "  32'  Forest break on the counter and Lingard tries to release Awoniyi, but the flag goes up late after the forward fails to round Fabianski.   ", "  34'  Forest have already had more shots in this match (six) than they managed against Newcastle last weekend (five).   ", "  36'  Benrahma twists and turns his way past Worrall in the inside-left channel and he fires a ball into the middle. However, Bowen fails to react and cannot steer a strike towards goal. Johnson stoops to connect with a cross from Toffolo that travels to Williams at the back post. He fires at goal from six yards, but Fabianski puts his body on the line to make the save.   ", "  42'  West Ham have the ball in the net, but there will be a VAR check.   ", "  44'  VAR! DISALLOWED GOAL! Williams cuts in from the right flank and connects with his left-footed strike, but Fabianski gets down to make a fine stop.   ", "  45' + 1'  There will be three minutes of added time.   ", "        T. Awoniyi   Goal               45' + 2'  GOALLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLL!!!! AWONIYI BUNDLES THE BALL HOME!!!! 1-0 FOREST!!!!! Forest have their first Premier League goal in 23 years as Awoniyi uses his knee to find the back of the net. Toffolo makes a great run into the box and cuts the ball back to Lingard. He should hit the back of the net, but scuffs his effort. Fortunately for the home side, it deflects off Johnson and onto the knee of Awoniyi before rolling into the bottom-left corner. What a way to get your first Forest goal!   ", "  45' + 3'  HALF-TIME: NOTTINGHAM FOREST 1-0 WEST HAM UNITED   ", "   Nottingham Forest hold a 1-0 lead over West Ham United at half-time in their Premier League clash at the City Ground. The first half was played at a brisk tempo, but the wait for goalmouth action took until the closing minutes. The Hammers believed they had gone ahead through Said Benrahma, only for the goal to be disallowed for a foul on Orel Mangala in the build-up. Forest capitalised on the decision and took the lead with the aid of fortune as Jesse Lingard's strike deflected off Ben Johnson onto the knee of Taiwo Awoniyi, and into the back of the net.   ", "   Steve Cooper will be thrilled with his side's performance. They've been up for the challenge from the off and played with great intensity, which was lacking last week. Forest now need to build on their effort and look to take the game away from the Hammers in the second half. The hosts should expect a response from David Moyes and his team, especially considering the drama in the closing minutes.   ", "  46'  We're back under way at the City Ground. ", "  53'  West Ham are finding space with ease in the Forest half at the moment. Bowen and Benrahma are causing problems down both flanks.   ", "  55'  VAR! DISALLOWED GOAL! ", "  90' + 9'  FULL-TIME: NOTTINGHAM FOREST 1-0 WEST HAM UNITED   ", "   Nottingham Forest secure their first Premier League victory of the season by beating West Ham United 1-0 at the City Ground. Taiwo Awoniyi's goal was enough to secure the three points for the home side, although they had to ride their luck at times. The Hammers will not believe they lost the game as Said Benrahma had a goal disallowed by VAR and then struck the bar in the second half. Pablo Fornals also hit the bar before Tomas Soucek was denied by Dean Henderson. To cap it off, Declan Rice missed a penalty after Scott McKenna was penalised for handball. It was not always pretty from Forest, but Steve Cooper and his team will not care one bit.   ", '   Forest have momentum now to take into their Premier League clash with Everton next Saturday.
